alert.note: Alert for Crittenden (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 9:26PM CDT until March 31 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CRITTENDEN...WESTERN DESOTO AND NORTHEASTERN TUNICA COUNTIES... At 925 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Robinsonville, or 10 miles southeast of Hughes, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado 4 miles west of Robinsonville. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Horseshoe Lake, Pinckney, Lake Cormorant, Eudora, Robinsonville, Newport, Clack, Trinity, Commerce, Hollywood, Lost Lake, Seyppel, Bruins, Beck, Glover, Banks, Penton, Bowdre and Norfolk. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
